SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SYNC MANAGEMENT
Downloading Latest Metadata

If you haven’t made metadata changes from the Sync Configurator tab, for example field sets or permission sets, force the update.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience in Enterprise and Unlimited Editions that have Consumer Goods Cloud enabled

Based on the metadata, apply the changes in different ways.

Metadata Change	How to Apply the Change
A deployment file is added and the status is changed to Published or Revoked, or Published At or Installation Deadline timestamps are updated.	Launch or log in to the mobile app. The app downloads the deployment file, tracked objects, and named fetch tree, and named query configuration settings from the Sync Configurator. The app also downloads all relevant metadata changes that the Sync Configurator doesn’t directly control, such as sharing rules.
Tracked object configuration is changed.	Launch or log in to the mobile offline app. The app downloads the tracked object settings from Sync Configurator.
Assignment of sync configuration is changed.	Launch or log in to the mobile offline app. The app downloads only the tracked object configurations and their metadata.
Named queries are changed.	No action is required. The changes apply during the next synchronization of the mobile app, which also downloads the named query configuration.
Named fetch trees are changed.	No action is required. The changes apply during the next synchronization of the mobile app, which also downloads the named fetch tree configuration.
A new sync configuration is created.	No action is required. The changes apply during the next synchronization of the mobile app, which also downloads only the sync configuration.
Download Latest Metadata
To reset metadata timestamps and download the latest metadata from the server, force a client metadata update.

title: Managing Sync Configuration and Deployment Packages
